title: Week 1: Introduction to AI
description: History of AI, core concepts, applications, and types of AI. Students will define AI and identify its branches and applications.

title: Week 2: Agent Architectures
description: Covers intelligent agents, agent environments, and rationality. The focus will be on analyzing the structure of agents and their interaction with environments.

title: Week 3: Search Algorithms
description: Introduction to uninformed search strategies (BFS, DFS) and informed (heuristic) search. Students will implement and compare search algorithms.

title: Week 4: Constraint Satisfaction Problems
description: Definition, examples, and methods for solving Constraint Satisfaction Problems (CSPs). The week will emphasize formulating and solving CSPs.

title: Week 5: Multi-Agent Search and Game Playing
description: Explores game theory and adversarial search strategies (Minimax, Alpha-Beta pruning). Students will develop game-playing strategies and understand multi-agent dynamics.

title: Week 6: Logic Reasoning: Propositional Logic
description: Focuses on components of propositional logic and methods of inference. Students will use propositional logic to perform reasoning tasks.

title: Week 7: First-Order Logic
description: Introduction to first-order logic and its applications. Students will construct first-order logic statements and queries.

title: Week 8: Probabilistic Reasoning and Bayes' Theorem
description: Introduction to probabilistic reasoning and Bayesian networks. Students will apply Bayes' theorem in decision-making problems.

title: Week 9: Deep Reinforcement Learning
description: Covers architectures and applications of deep reinforcement learning. Students will implement and evaluate deep reinforcement learning algorithms.

title: Week 10: Bayesian Networks
description: Focus on structure and inference in Bayesian networks. Students will develop and reason with Bayesian models.

title: Weeks 11 - 12: Decision Making and Reinforcement Learning
description: Introduction to Markov Decision Processes and reinforcement learning basics. Students will solve problems using MDPs and apply reinforcement learning techniques.

title: Weeks 13 - 14: Deep Learning Basics
description: Exploration of neural network architectures and training paradigms. Students will understand and implement basic neural networks.

title: Week 15: Ethical Considerations in AI
description: Discussion on ethical implications of AI technologies and responsible development. Students will analyze ethical dilemmas related to AI applications.

title: Week 16: Project Presentations and Final Review
description: Student project presentations demonstrating learning outcomes. This week includes presenting and defending AI projects as well as reviewing course concepts in preparation for the final exam.
